series.series.name: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- ECAC CHAMPIONSHIPS

abstract.p: April Byrd wins long jump at women's Eastern College Athletic Conference track and field championships (S)

block.p: April Byrd of Boston University defeated Nolle Graham of Seton Hall by one centimeter to win the long jump yesterday in the 17th annual women's Eastern College Athletic Conference track and field championships at Princeton's Weaver Stadium.

April Byrd of Boston University defeated Nolle Graham of Seton Hall by one centimeter to win the long jump yesterday in the 17th annual women's Eastern College Athletic Conference track and field championships at Princeton's Weaver Stadium.
Gabrielle Deshong of Virginia Commonwealth won the heptathlon with 5,164 points, and Gwen Knorr of Pittsburgh won the javelin at 156-3.

In the 124th annual men's IC4A championships, which was being held concurrently with the ECAC meet, Jacob Freeman, a Manhattan College freshman, won the hammer throw with a 216-7 effort on his last throw. Scott Denbo of Princeton took the shot put at 62-i, and Anthony Wallace of James Madison the long jump at 24-3.
PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- ECAC CHAMPIONSHIPS
